critique: This document pertains to civil service regulations during Grover Cleveland's presidency. It modifies Departmental Rule VII, specifically concerning promotions within the classified departmental service. The amendment restricts certifications for vacancies above a certain grade (class I) in departments with promotion regulations under General Rule III, section 6. This appears to be an effort to manage internal promotions and hiring within the civil service. There's no clear indication of ideological bias, immigration stance, expansion of executive power, or a shift in federalism. The document seems neutral regarding national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, and social inclusion. Therefore, the initial scores are set to 0 across all axes.
